gurmukhi: sunhu ibAws qy prb AstM dswnM ]
transliteration: Sounoh Biaas Te Parab Astan Dasaanan||
translation: “O King ! Listen from Vyas eighteen Parvas (parts) of Mahabharata;

gurmukhi: dhY dyh qy kust srbM niRpwnM ]
transliteration: Dahai Deh Te Koust Saraban Nripaanan||
translation: “Then all the ailment of leprosy will be removed from thy body.”

gurmukhi: bolY ibpR ibAwsM sunY lwg prbM ]
transliteration: Dolai Bipra Biaasan Sounai Laag Paraban||
translation: The eminent Brahmin Vyas was then called and the king began to listen to the Parvas (of Mahabharata).

gurmukhi: pirE BUp pwien qjy srb grbM ]39]207]
transliteration: Pario Bhoop Paain Taje Sarab Gadaban||39||207||
translation: The king fell at the feet of Vyas forsaking all pride.39.207.
(Vyas said J Listen, O Supreme monarch ! the treasure of learning;

gurmukhi: huE Brq ky bMs mY r`GurwnM ]
transliteration: Hooo Bharat Ke Bans Mai Ragghuraanan||
translation: In the linege of Bharat, there was a king named Raghu;

gurmukhi: BieE qaun ky bMs mY rwm rwjw ]
transliteration: Bhaio Taoun Ke Bans Mai Raam Raajaa||
translation: In his line, there was the king Rama;
Who gave the gift of life to the kashatriyas from the wrath of Parasurama and also the treasures and comfortable living.40.208.

gurmukhi: BieE qaun kI j`d mY j`du rwjM ]
transliteration: Bhaio Taoun Kijadd Mai Jadd(u) Raajan||
translation: In his clan, there was a king named Yadu;

gurmukhi: dsM cwr cOdh su ib`idAw smwjM ]
transliteration: Dasan Chaar Chaudah Su Biddiaa Samaajan||
translation: Who was erudite in all fourteen learnings;

gurmukhi: BieE qaun ky bMs mY sMqnyAM ]
transliteration: Bhaio Taoun Ke Bans Mai Santnean||
translation: In his family, there was a king named Santanu;

gurmukhi: Bey qwih ky kaur Aau pwNfvyAM ]41]209]
transliteration: Bhae Taah(i) Ke Kaur Au Paandvean||41||209||
translation: In his line, there were then Kaurvas and Pandavas.41.209.

gurmukhi: Bey qaun ky bMs mY piRqrwstrM ]
transliteration: Bhae Taoun Ke Bans Mai Dhritraastaran||
translation: In his family, there was Dhritrashtra,

gurmukhi: mhw ju`D joDw pRboDw mhwN sqRM ]
transliteration: Mahaa Juddh Jodhaa Prabodhaa Mahaan Satran||
translation: Who was a great hero in wars and a teacher of great enemies.
